step1.para: If previously removed, install the bearing inner race on the front of each countershaft ( Figure 276).

figure.caption: Figure 275. Install Bearing Inner Race on Front of Each Countershaft

step1.para:
IMPORTANT: On the low range gear of each auxiliary countershaft assembly, use a highly visible toolmaker's dye to mark the tooth stamped with an "O" for timing purposes
( Figure 277).

figure.caption: Figure 276. Mark Tooth For Timing Purposes

step1.para: Place one of the assemblies into position in the rear plate, meshing the marked tooth of the countershaft low range gear with either set of two marked teeth of the low range gear on the output shaft ( inset, Figure 278). Center rear of the countershaft in the bearing bore, start rear bearing in bore and complete installation with a flanged-end driver and maul. Repeat the procedure with the other auxiliary countershaft assembly, making sure the low range gear set remains in time during bearing installation.

figure.caption: Figure 277. Place One Assembly into Position in Rear Plate, and Start Rear Bearing in Bore

note.para: Check synchronizer assembly for springs that may be released during bearing installation.

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the groove at the rear of each countershaft ( Figure 279).

figure.caption: Figure 278. Install Snap Ring in Groove at Countershaft Rear

step1.para: Position the new gasket on the cover mounting surface and install both rear bearing covers ( Figure 280). Apply Loctite 242 to the bolt threads and tighten to secure covers to auxiliary housing.
